member.name: T:System.IO.Compression.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Specifies values that indicate whether a compression operation emphasizes speed or compression size.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.CompressionLevel.Fastest
member.summary: The compression operation should complete as quickly as possible, even if the resulting file is not optimally compressed.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.CompressionLevel.NoCompression
member.summary: No compression should be performed on the file.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.CompressionLevel.Optimal
member.summary: The compression operation should be optimally compressed, even if the operation takes a longer time to complete.

member.name: T:System.IO.Compression.CompressionMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to compress or decompress the underlying stream.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.CompressionMode.Compress
member.summary: Compresses the underlying stream.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.CompressionMode.Decompress
member.summary: Decompresses the underlying stream.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation. (Consider using the method instead.)
member.param: The byte array to read the data into.
The byte offset in at which to begin reading data from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the read operation is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.

member.exception: The method tried to read asynchronously past the end of the stream, or a disk error occurred.

The write operation cannot be performed because the stream is closed.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.DeflateStream.CopyTo(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the bytes from the current Deflate stream and writes them to another stream, using a specified buffer size.
member.param: The stream to which the contents of the current Deflate stream will be copied.
The size of the buffer. This value must be greater than zero. The default size is 81920.

The size, in bytes, of the buffer. This value must be greater than zero. The default size is 81920.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous copy operation.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.DeflateStream.Read(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current Deflate stream into a byte span and advances the position within the Deflate stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: A region of memory. When this method returns, the contents of this region are replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes allocated in the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.DeflateStream.ReadAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current Deflate stream, writes them to a byte array, advances the position within the Deflate stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The buffer to write the data into.
The byte offset in at which to begin writing data from the Deflate stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation, which wraps the total number of bytes read into the . The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the Deflate stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.DeflateStream.ReadAsync(System.Memory{System.Byte},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current Deflate stream, writes them to a byte memory range, advances the position within the Deflate stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.
member.param: The region of memory to write the data into.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation, which wraps the total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the number of bytes allocated in the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the Deflate stream has been reached.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.DeflateStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the Deflate stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the Deflate stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an , or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.DeflateStream.Write(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})

member.summary: Asynchronously writes compressed bytes to the underlying Deflate stream from the specified byte array.

One of the enumeration values that indicates whether the zip archive is used to read, create, or update entries.
to leave the stream open after the object is disposed; otherwise, .

The encoding to use when reading or writing entry names in this archive. Specify a value for this parameter only when an encoding is required for interoperability with zip archive tools and libraries that do not support UTF-8 encoding for entry names.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchive.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchive.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called by the and methods to release the unmanaged resources used by the current instance of the class, and optionally finishes writing the archive and releases the managed resources.
member.param: to finish writing the archive and release unmanaged and managed resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry
member.summary: Represents a compressed file within a zip archive.

member.summary: Gets the zip archive that the entry belongs to.

member.name: P:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry.ExternalAttributes

member.name: P:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry.LastWriteTime

member.returns: The last time the entry in the zip archive was changed.
member.exception: The attempt to set this property failed, because the zip archive for the entry is in mode.
The archive mode is set to . -or- The archive mode is set to and the entry has been opened.
An attempt was made to set this property to a value that is either earlier than 1980 January 1 0:00:00 (midnight) or later than 2107 December 31 23:59:58 (one second before midnight).

member.name: T:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveMode
member.summary: Specifies values for interacting with zip archive entries.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveMode.Create
member.summary: Only creating new archive entries is permitted.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveMode.Read
member.summary: Only reading archive entries is permitted.

member.name: F:System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveMode.Update
member.summary: Both read and write operations are permitted for archive entries.
